primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God enters the human condition of futility and death (the 'hospital bed') to rescue and heal the helpless human race through the Cross.

tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord turned and looked at Peter
He himself bore our sins in his body on the tree
God has entered human flesh and laid himself down on our hospital bed

object.identificatie: The human person (the 'man in the bed') / Redemption from vanity
tekstueel_bewijs: By his wounds you have been healed
He sees a person that he loves more than life

zender.identificatie: The Most High God / The Truth of Reality
tekstueel_bewijs: This is a message from the Most High God
The Bible teaches us to see ourselves as God sees us
to those who are called... Christ is the power of God
so that by his poverty you might become rich
the Cross is the power of God
Ecclesiastes plays a very important role in Scripture

tegenstander.identificatie: Vanity (Futility), Sin, Death, and Positive Thinking (Denial)
tekstueel_bewijs: all is vanity and a striving after wind
the cultural demand to be constantly uplifted... works against the heart of the Christian faith
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a bad habit but 'Original Sin' and the ontological reality of death ('one fate comes to all').

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of confession and 'living to righteousness' following the healing.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Confession is presented as a 'joyful' result of no longer needing to pretend, enabled by God's prior look of love.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Most High God → Salvation/Healing → The Man in the Bed

voorbeelden_god_subject: God sees us in the full dimensions of our weakness
He has taken ultimate shame and weakness upon himself
The Lord looks on the heart
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We have followed too much the devices and desires of our own hearts
We try all our lives to beat back that awful fact

voorbeelden: things which we ought to have done
to understand who we are in the sight of God
God does not give him power to enjoy them
Christ is the power of God

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes the total lack of human 'Pouvoir' (power) to overcome death or vanity, positioning Grace as the external 'Pouvoir' of God.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From ~S1 (Denial) to S2 (The reality of the bed/death), then to ~S2 (Confession), finally resolving in S1 (The Cross).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God entering S2 (the bed of death) to bring the Subject into S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; the sermon spends significant time on the 'unhappy business' of Ecclesiastes.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. It identifies the human condition as one of total inability and positions God as the sole active Subject of rescue.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The God who parted the Red Sea... has entered human flesh and laid himself down on our hospital bed.
What is crooked cannot be made straight.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Peter and David are used not as models to emulate, but as examples of those whom God sees and calls despite their failure.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: God sees the 'liar and coward' and loves him.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and 'joy' through the cessation of 'pretending'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'vanity' of Ecclesiastes to the 'victory' of the Cross is seamless and logically grounded in the nature of God's love.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He himself bore our sins in his body on the tree

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon focuses on Christological action rather than Pneumatological process.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is linked to the 'primordial calamity' and 'sickness unto death'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon perfectly maintains God as the Subject. The 'Man in the Bed' is the quintessential Receiver.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is appropriate for a grace-oriented sermon.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology precedes and enables the secondary program of 'living to righteousness'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that uses the 'Opponent' of vanity to magnify the 'Subject' of Christ.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the hospital bed metaphor's pathos, Greimas reveals that the bed is a state of 'non-competence' (deprivation of Pouvoir) that only a divine Subject can resolve.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the historical context of Qoheleth; Greimas shows how Qoheleth functions as the 'Sender' of a specific value system (realism) that prepares the 'Receiver' for the Gospel.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights the 'Subject-Switch' in the final paragraphs where the 'Master of the Universe' becomes the 'Man in the Bed', a radical actantial inversion.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'look' of God as the primary act of the Subject, establishing a relationship before the Performance of the Cross.
